Message: @Feanor if you recall Two rooms and a boom
I need to go for like 5 minutes I'll be back :)
ignoramus votes to put Feanor on trial
I guess it's loosely inspired by that
That and the April Fools stuff I made
However that had a lot more interesting discussions instead of random throwing stuff.
it just presents a different type of meta
I don't know any of the april fools stuff since I left during that game so I kind of missed everything that went down there.
Some people started with pretty red candles
Some people started with acme paper weights
It ended in a fucking massive explosion.
I'm still amused by that meme with Archie going off about making Helix explode when they were both in the same night chat
"Guise, it took some time, but I managed it, I cracked it, I think I finally found out who Helix is"
"It's all apart of the big explosive plan"
I did not read that yet.
thoughts on the mode, things that are needed for it etc are all welcome
it's basically slowly evolved from feedback
including the getting extra dealings of items and such
m o r e  s p i c e
we'll trry with the neutral role in it
Each player has received one random item from the following deck - x3 AcmePaperweight, x1 PotionOfAcquiescence, x1 UnlitDynamite

FlavourText: Coldness creeps in as the daylight fades...

DetailedDescription: You hold the boom, and must decide on how long to set the fuse for. If you do not choose a fuse length, it will be chosen for you
The lit dynamite will then be passed to a random member on the opposite team
Choose when the dynamite goes boom:

Description: A nifty black spheroid with a slightly flattened base to keep any papers from flying away in the wind. It has 'ACME' embossed on the side and for some reason, it came with lots of warnings in the box. Warnings like 'do not shake' 'do not move suddenly' and 'keep away from other explosions'.
A Potion of Acquiescence can be used once to steal any items the target player has

A nifty black spheroid with a slightly flattened base to keep any papers from flying away in the wind. It has 'ACME' embossed on the side and for some reason, it came with lots of warnings in the box. Warnings like 'do not shake' 'do not move suddenly' and 'keep away from other explosions'.

A nifty black spheroid with a slightly flattened base to keep any papers from flying away in the wind. It has 'ACME' embossed on the side and for some reason, it came with lots of warnings in the box. Warnings like 'do not shake' 'do not move suddenly' and 'keep away from other explosions'.

DetailedDescription: You may select which faction to side with
You cannot swap sides once you make a decision
If you have not picked a side by the end of the game you will lose

Confirmation: Tonight you will pass your ACME Paperweight to $NicolBolas
Tonight you will pass your Unlit Dynamite to $ignoramus

Message: Each player has received one random item from the following deck - x1 HvislaRune, x1 AvslojaRune, x2 AvledaRune, x1 AltruisticTrinket
What does the neutral do btw? :)
At beginning or right before explosion?
And I presume they lose if they haven't chosen when thing goes off
Uncle Sam wants YOU to join the masons
Imagine dying as a neutral without choosing

Description: An Avleda Rune allows you redirect all visits to a target player to yourself for one night. This includes item usage and item transfers. Holding it will make you appear as a Witch Craft user to intel checks. After use, a Rune must recharge and can be used again by you three nights later. If you pass the Rune to a different player they will be able to use it immediately.

A nifty black spheroid with a slightly flattened base to keep any papers from flying away in the wind. It has 'ACME' embossed on the side and for some reason, it came with lots of warnings in the box. Warnings like 'do not shake' 'do not move suddenly' and 'keep away from other explosions'.

A nifty black spheroid with a slightly flattened base to keep any papers from flying away in the wind. It has 'ACME' embossed on the side and for some reason, it came with lots of warnings in the box. Warnings like 'do not shake' 'do not move suddenly' and 'keep away from other explosions'.

A Hvísla Rune allows you to talk to a player the following night. The other player will see all the messages you send at night but will not know who is sending them. Holding it will make you appear as a Witch Craft user to intel checks. After use, a Rune must recharge and can be used again by you three nights later. If you pass the Rune to a different player they will be able to use it immediately.
A Potion of Acquiescence can be used once to steal any items the target player has

An Avleda Rune allows you redirect all visits to a target player to yourself for one night. This includes item usage and item transfers. Holding it will make you appear as a Witch Craft user to intel checks. After use, a Rune must recharge and can be used again by you three nights later. If you pass the Rune to a different player they will be able to use it immediately.
A small trinket depicting a child in rags giving away their toy to a smaller child. You can't help but feel moved when you look at it.
